definition:
We are said to be using if we write functions to the left of their
arguments. That is, if $\alpha : X \to Y$ is a function and $x \in X$,
then $\alpha x$ is the image of $x$ under $\alpha$.

Furthermore, if we have a function $\beta : Y \to Z$, then we write the
composition of the two functions as $\beta \alpha : X \to Z$, and the
image of $x$ under the composition as
$\beta \alpha x = (\beta \alpha) x = \beta(\alpha x)$.

Compare this to right function notation.
